subject: Languages
title: Sprachbund: Neighbors That Think Alike
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sprachbund: Neighbors That Think Alike.

hook.text: Unrelated languages spoken near each other can start sharing grammar â€” becoming alike without being related.

buildup.text: A Sprachbund (language area) is a group of languages that share features through centuries of contact.

discovery.text: The Balkan Sprachbund: Albanian, Romanian, Bulgarian, and Greek all share features despite being unrelated branches.

twist.text: These shared features include postposed articles and loss of the infinitive â€” borrowed through bilingualism.

climax.text: Sprachbunds prove that geographic contact can be as powerful as genetic descent in shaping languages.

punchline.text: Live next to someone long enough and you'll start finishing each other's grammar.

quiz.question: What is a Sprachbund?
options: Unrelated languages that share features from centuries of contact
